input_action.name: ScrapUnits
input_action.description: Sometimes you need to get rid of something in order to free up ship cap somewhere else, or -- more likely -- free up Energy.

input_action.name: TogglePause
input_action.description: Toggle the game between running and paused states. You can still give orders and look around while paused.

input_action.name: TogglePauseAlt
input_action.description: Toggle the game between running and paused states. You can still give orders and look around while paused.

input_action.name: OpenTechTab
input_action.description: Switch to the tech tab of the sidebar.

input_action.name: OpenOpsTab
input_action.description: Switch to the outguard tab of the sidebar (remnants of other human settlements who wish to help you).

input_action.name: OpenShipsTab
input_action.description: Switch to the 'at local planet' tab of the sidebar.

input_action.name: OpenFleetsTab
input_action.description: Switch to the fleets tab of the sidebar.

input_action.name: OpenHackingTab
input_action.description: Switch to the hacking tab of the sidebar.

input_action.name: OpenObjectivesTab
input_action.description: Switch to the intel tab of the sidebar.

input_action.name: ToggleFRD
input_action.description: Switch the selected ships into or out of pursuit mode (was once called 'FRD'). While in pursuit mode, military ships will make their own choices about who to go attack, then will go fly off to fight them. In pursuit mode, engineers and rebuilders will go anywhere on the planet they feel they are needed.

input_action.name: ToggleAttackMove
input_action.description: Switch the selected ships into or out of attack-move mode. While in attack-move mode, military ships will make their own choices about who to go attack that they see in range of themselves, and then will kite them and potentially chase them. Unlike in pursuit mode, they will not start chasing something that is out of their range, however.

input_action.name: ToggleEnabled
input_action.description:
Switch the selected ships into or out of functioning ('hold fire' mode for military ships). While disabled, military ships will not attack anything they see. This is very useful for ships that are cloaked that you want to keep stealthy.
When disabled, you can also save metal: engineers will not spend metal doing work, and factories will not run, under-construction ships and structures won't build, etc.

input_action.name: OpenSystemMenu
input_action.description: This button opens the menu from which you can save, quit, etc. It also acts as a cancel button on a lot of screens.

input_action.name: ApplyGroupMoveLogic
input_action.description: Switch the selected ships to all keep track of each other's speeds and move only as fast as the slowest among them. Or take them out of that mode if they're all already grouped together in that way.

input_action.name: ApplyAttackMoveLogic
input_action.description: Your ships will always shoot at enemies they pass as they head where they are going. Toggle on this mode to make them actually stop to fight anything they run across.

input_action.name: UnloadTransports
input_action.description: Any mobile fleet flagships that you have selected will immediately unload any ships they are presently transporting.

input_action.name: LoadTransports
input_action.description: Any mobile fleet flagships that you have selected will immediately go into 'load mode', causing any new ships that are added to their fleet to appear inside them instead of next to them, and for all their existing ships will cause them to move at 3x their normal speed to get inside their flagship for transport if their flagship is on the same planet.

input_action.name: Return
input_action.description: Determines which key functions as the Enter/Return key in the menus.
